vocab.definition: A state of reflecting others’ emotions rather than showing one’s own.
vocab.usage_example: You’re in mirror-skin right now—only bouncing back what the world throws.

vocab.definition: A heavy idea that stains every other idea around it.
vocab.usage_example: That worry is an ink-thought; it colours everything else.

vocab.definition: Growth that happens quietly, invisibly, but undeniably.
vocab.usage_example: Your confidence is a silent-bloom—you don’t see it, but everyone else does.

vocab.definition: A surface-level calm that tears instantly under pressure.
vocab.usage_example: Your paper-thin calm is brave, but it won’t hold if someone pushes.

vocab.definition: A truth that only illuminates a small circle around you; incomplete but useful.
vocab.usage_example: That’s a lantern-truth—helpful, but be careful; it hides as much as it reveals.

vocab.definition: Evidence of something that passed quickly through your life.
vocab.usage_example: There’s a wind-mark on you from that conversation—you’re changed, even if you deny it.

vocab.definition: A moment of clarity that disappears as soon as you look directly at it.
vocab.usage_example: That plan was a sun-flicker—bright but impossible to hold.

vocab.definition: A pause that lets you rewrite how you feel before you speak.
vocab.usage_example: Take one ink-breath before answering; you’ll rewrite the outcome.

vocab.definition: Letting your thoughts flow instead of forcing them into shape.
vocab.usage_example: Try river-focus; the answer will float to you without pushing.

vocab.definition: A commitment that weighs more than the person who made it realises.
vocab.usage_example: That’s a stone-promise—careful, it will anchor your whole path.

vocab.definition: A pride that glows dangerously when stirred.
vocab.usage_example: Your ember-ego is showing—step gently or it’ll flare.

vocab.definition: Moving around conflict rather than through it.
vocab.usage_example: Nice water-step—you dodged the chaos without making a ripple.

vocab.definition: Discipline that resists fear, pressure, and noise.
vocab.usage_example: Use iron-mind here—don’t let their panic shape you.

vocab.definition: A moment where everything unnecessary disappears.
vocab.usage_example: Take a void-breath; the noise will fall away.

vocab.definition: A silence that hums with meaning rather than emptiness.
vocab.usage_example: That was bell-silence—loud without speaking.

vocab.definition: A truth that becomes clear only when you slow down.
vocab.usage_example: Sit. Breathe. The tea-truth will come on its own.

vocab.definition: Meditation through movement rather than stillness.
vocab.usage_example: Take a riddle-walk; answers like to follow moving feet.

vocab.definition: Acting without ego, fear, or expectation.
vocab.usage_example: Use empty-step—respond without carrying the weight.

vocab.definition: Letting thoughts drift without trying to hold them.
vocab.usage_example: Try cloud-mind; thinking harder won’t help here.

vocab.definition: A talent that grows strongest when unnoticed.
vocab.usage_example: Your intuition is a shadow-gift—it works better when you stop trying.

vocab.definition: Playfulness with a hidden motive.
vocab.usage_example: Careful, that smile is pure fox-mirth—you’re planning something.

vocab.definition: A fleeting moment where the world feels thinner than usual.
vocab.usage_example: That idea came from a spirit-glimmer—don’t question it too hard.

pairs.connection: stillness inside motion is the essence of mastery
pairs.usage_example: Your mind is still-moving—you look calm, but everything is happening at once.

pairs.connection: soft words can cut the deepest
pairs.usage_example: That was a soft-sharp moment—gentle tone, brutal meaning.
